[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Integration: DKG protocol] In PVSS protocols using Curve25519, can an attacker submit invalid shares (using torsion points or identity elements) that pass verification but cause share reconstruction to fail? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Integration: Ciphertext compression] When ElGamal ciphertext components are compressed and transmitted, can decompression produce a different valid point (due to sign ambiguity), enabling ciphertext malleability attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Integration: Randomness reuse] If the same random scalar is used in multiple encrypt() calls with Curve25519, can an attacker correlate ciphertexts to break semantic security of veiled coin balances? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Type safety: EdwardsPoint] Does the EdwardsPoint type from curve25519_dalek guarantee points are on the curve, or can unsafe operations create invalid points that bypass validation in ElGamal operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Type safety: Scalar] Does the Scalar type enforce automatic reduction modulo the curve order, or can unreduced scalars leak through and cause incorrect cryptographic operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Memory safety: Point arithmetic] Can point arithmetic operations (add, sub, mul) trigger buffer overflows or memory corruption in the underlying curve25519_dalek library, enabling RCE on validator nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Unsafe code: Curve25519_dalek] Does the curve25519_dalek dependency use any unsafe Rust code that could lead to memory safety violations, and has this code been audited for security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Thread safety: RNG] Is the RNG passed to rand_scalar() thread-safe, or can concurrent calls from multiple threads cause RNG state corruption that produces predictable scalars? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Panic safety: Point operations] Can any of the point operations (add, sub, mul) panic due to invalid inputs, causing validator crashes during ElGamal encryption/decryption in consensus-critical paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Lifetime issues: Element references] Are Element references properly managed to prevent use-after-free vulnerabilities when EdwardsPoint values are passed between functions in ElGamal operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Protocol: IND-CPA] Does the Curve25519 implementation ensure IND-CPA security for ElGamal encryption, or can an attacker distinguish between encryptions of different messages by observing ciphertext patterns in veiled coin transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Protocol: Malleability] Can an attacker modify an ElGamal ciphertext (by adding random group elements) to produce a different ciphertext that decrypts to a related plaintext, enabling unauthorized veiled coin transfers? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Protocol: Replay attacks] Does the Curve25519 implementation prevent replay of old ElGamal ciphertexts in veiled coin transfers, or can an attacker replay encrypted withdrawal transactions to drain accounts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Protocol: Known plaintext] If an attacker knows some encrypted values (e.g., standard coin denominations), can they use homomorphic properties of add() to learn information about other encrypted balances? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Protocol: Chosen ciphertext] Can an attacker submit chosen ElGamal ciphertexts to a decryption oracle (e.g., through veiled coin withdrawal validation) to extract private key bits through timing or error analysis? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Protocol: Forward secrecy] Does ElGamal over Curve25519 provide forward secrecy, or can compromise of a long-term private key enable decryption of all past veiled coin transactions stored on-chain? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Protocol: Key reuse] Can the same ElGamal keypair be safely reused across multiple contexts (veiled coins, DKG, hybrid encryption), or does key reuse enable cross-protocol attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Side-channel: Cache timing] Do point operations in Curve25519 access memory in data-dependent patterns that leak information through cache timing, enabling recovery of scalars or points used in ElGamal encryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Side-channel: Branch prediction] Does the curve25519_dalek library use conditional branches that depend on secret data, enabling branch prediction attacks to leak scalar bits during ElGamal decryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Side-channel: Power analysis] Can an attacker perform simple power analysis (SPA) or differential power analysis (DPA) on validator hardware during ElGamal operations to recover private keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Side-channel: Electromagnetic] Are ElGamal operations on Curve25519 vulnerable to electromagnetic (EM) side-channel attacks that can be performed remotely on validator hardware to extract secrets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Side-channel: Fault injection] Can fault injection attacks (voltage glitching, clock glitching) during point multiplication cause mul() to skip iterations, producing a related output that leaks private key information? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Side-channel: Microarchitectural] Are Curve25519 operations vulnerable to Spectre/Meltdown-style microarchitectural attacks that can leak cryptographic material through speculative execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Dependency: curve25519_dalek version] Is the curve25519_dalek dependency pinned to a specific audited version, or can automatic updates introduce vulnerabilities that break ElGamal security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/curve25519.rs] [Dependency: Known CVEs] Does the curve25519_dalek version used have any known CVEs related to point arithmetic, scalar operations, or side-channel vulnerabilities? (Critical)
